title: Beth Stern agrees to remarry Howard Stern after surprise proposal on 'Jimmy Kimmel'
text:
CLOSE

Howard and Beth Stern attend the North Shore Animal League America Gala on Dec. 1, 2017 in New York City. (Photo: Jamie McCarthy/Getty Images)

Softened shock jock Howard Stern is still able to surprise his wife, Beth Stern.

The SiriusXM host who doesn't hold back popped the question to his spouse while appearing on Wednesday's "Jimmy Kimmel Live!"

Stern recalled a trip he and the late night host took to Tennessee, where he shared around the dinner table that he keeps proposing to his wife since 2008 that they marry again, only for her to decline.

"I'm talking to Jimmy, and I said, 'You know, it's embarrassing. I have asked my wife to remarry me. We got married … 11 years ago, but we've been together like 20-something years."

Stern remembered saying to Kimmel: "Watch this, I'm gonna say to my wife, 'I want to remarry you. I want to propose,' and I'm gonna say, 'Marry me again.' She always says no. Because she thinks it's jinxed if you get married again, but it's so great. I love the proposal."

"When I propose to my wife, she gets embarrassed," Stern continued, "and she just – honey, come up here. I want to propose."

Taking Beth's hands and dropping to a knee, Stern told her, "Darling, you know you have given me the best years of my life. I love you so much. You do so much for animal rescue. You know how I feel about you. I'm gonna say to you now, in front of all of my best friends (gestures to studio audience), my sweet love, will you marry me again?"

After a simple "yes," the two shared a short peck.

Earlier in the year, Beth debunked split rumors as a guest on "The Ellen DeGeneres Show" in January.

The rumor mill began earlier in the month when the pair had a disagreement, and Beth told her husband that he was being "grumpy" and a "Debbie Downer."

Stern then discussed their issues on air, which fueled reports. She said strangers stopped her in the street and wished her well.

"The other day, someone comes up to me and said, 'I’m so sorry about what’s going on with you and Howard, I hope you make it,' " Beth recalled. "I had no idea what was going on."

Denying the reports, she said: "I’m setting the record straight right here. I love my Howard."
